triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Provides the foundational framework for modeling and coordinating multiple interacting robots in multirobot systems.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Inspires the competitive and collaborative coordination behaviors observed in natural swarm systems that the paper emphasizes.

triples.name: Recurrent neural network
triples.relevance: Forms the basis of the single-layer neural dynamics solver used in the distributed coordination approach.

triples.name: Winner-take-all (computing)
triples.relevance: The k-winner-take-all concept is introduced as the novel driving principle for modeling multirobot competition.

triples.name: Consensus (computer science)
triples.relevance: Used in the distributed solver to transform global information into distributed type for decentralized coordination.

triples.name: Distributed computing
triples.relevance: Provides the theoretical foundation for the distributed coordination approach that avoids centralized control.

triples.name: Stability theory
triples.relevance: Used for proving convergence and stability of the proposed coordination approach through theoretical analysis.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Provides the mathematical and theoretical foundation for system optimization and stability analysis in multirobot control.
